CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant lives in a rented flat in a house in ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a certain PERSON converted an attic above the applicant 's flat into a flat and , without the required permit , moved in . She failed to carry out the necessary soundproofing work and , as a result , the applicant could be heard from her flat and is disturbed by noise coming from the flat above her .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant instituted administrative proceedings . She sought a demolition order in relation to the unauthorised flat .

CARDINAL . On DATE the mayor of ORG gave a decision ordering the compulsory demolition “ of the constituent elements of the flat ” and imposing on the co - owners of the building an obligation to restore the attic to its former condition ( przywrócenie stanu poprzedniego ) .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the co - owners of the building and PERSON appealed against that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( ORG ) quashed part of the challenged decision in so far as it imposed obligations on the co - owners of the building and upheld the remainder of the decision .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date PERSON lodged a complaint with ORG . She requested that both decisions be declared null and void .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) gave judgment and , for procedural reasons , quashed part of the challenged decision in so far as it had set aside the first - instance decision . The court dismissed the remainder of the complaint , with the result that the coowners of the house became obliged to carry out the demolition and to restore the attic to its previous condition .
CARDINAL . The obligations arising from the final judgment of ORG were not performed by the co - owners .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the administrative enforcement authority , namely the ORG ( Powiatowy Inspektor Nadzoru Budowlanego ) , sent a reminder to the co - owners to perform their obligations imposed by the final and enforceable decision of the ORG . The reminder remained ineffective .
CARDINAL . In DATE another reminder , also ineffective , was sent to the debtors .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG imposed a fine on the co - owners for non - performance of their obligations ( grzywna w celu przymuszenia ) . The fine was subsequently enforced but , as the co - owners had appealed against the decision imposing the fine and ORG quashed it , the amount paid had to be returned to the debtors .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's lawyer complained of the inactivity of the administrative authorities to ORG . He relied on the newly amended section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the DATE LAW ( ustawa o postępowaniu egzekucyjnym w administracji ) , which allowed creditors to lodge complaints about the excessive length of administrative enforcement proceedings . It appears that the applicant 's lawyer 's complaint remained ineffective .
CARDINAL . On DATE , relying on the same ground as previously , the applicant 's lawyer again complained about the excessive length of the administrative enforcement proceedings to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint , finding that the enforcement proceedings had been carried out properly and without undue delay . ORG mentioned ORG judgment , according to which the “ necessity of enforcing the demolition order can not lead to the carrying out of unlawful activities ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's lawyer lodged a further complaint about the excessive length of the administrative enforcement proceedings with ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP This complaint was not examined within the statutory time - limit . Therefore , on DATE , the applicant lodged an appeal with the Chief Inspector of ORG , complaining that the administrative case had not been examined within the prescribed time - limit .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief Inspector of Construction Supervision ordered ORG to examine the complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief Inspector of Construction Supervision upheld the decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint against that decision with ORG .
CARDINAL . Following the reform of the administrative courts in GPE , the complaint was transferred to ORG ( ORG PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment and dismissed the complaint . The court found that the decisions of the administrative authorities at first and second instance dismissing the applicant 's complaint about the excessive length of the enforcement proceedings had been given in accordance with the relevant provisions . It further found that the administrative authorities had conducted the proceedings “ without undue delay ” and that the enforcement could not be performed because PERSON still lived in the flat in question and had refused to leave it . Therefore , the persons responsible for enforcement of the final decision had to institute civil proceedings for termination of the lease agreement with PERSON and the proceedings were still pending , which constituted an objective obstacle to enforcement .

CARDINAL . NORP Irrespective of the official complaints about the excessive length of the enforcement proceedings lodged in accordance with ORG , the applicant sent reminders and letters to the administrative authorities , urging them to act ( letters of CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE ) . These letters , however , remained unanswered .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the DATE LAW ( ustawa o postępowaniu egzekucyjnym w administracji ) provides , in its relevant part , that a complaint about the excessive length of enforcement proceedings may also be lodged by a creditor who is not the administrative authority responsible for conducting the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE ( Prawo budowlane ) , as applicable at the material time , provided , in so far as relevant , as follows :

“ The relevant authority shall order that a building or part of a building be demolished if it is under construction or has been constructed without an appropriate permit or notification thereof , or contrary to the building permit ... ”
